author: Apples and Grapes for dinner

text: The violin solo reminds me of this Norwegian guy, Pete Johansen. He played in a few gothic metal bands (The Sins of Thy Beloved, Tristania) and had a similar sound, from my recollection.
author: MrRaindog

text: Agreed SO much with you.
author: Saelyth

text: shadow hearts covenant is my 2nd fave game on the ps2 only behind xenosaga episode 3 my fave game of all time
author: ho2da

text: +ho2da Man, I chill reading comments like yours because this should be quoted for the most truth. Okay, I'd not put Shadow Hearts 2 in the second place. Xenosaga 3 is faaaaaar the best game avaliable in the ps2 menu. My 2nd is Tales of the Abyss and, 3rd to Romacing Saga, 4th to FFX. I place SoH: Covenant behind SoH: From the New World still because of all the gameplay aspects, especially when it comes to the enormous improvements FtNW brought to the battle system (albeit the storyline of SoH 1 and 2 are far superior, I like the plot of FtNW too).
author: Leonardo Diniz

text: I though SH FtNW was terrible easily one of the worst ps2 games I've ever played in my opinion
author: ho2da

text: +ho2da most people do share your opinion. I understand it because the plot is really inferior to its prequels. As I said, I personally like it. But what really makes me a fan of  FtNW is the fact that I consider SoH the best JRpg Series when talking about gameplay aspects. And in addition to that FtNW was most perfect. The dungeons puzzles (I remember my Vilcabamba's genial puzzle up to nowsaday), the improvents to battle (stock bars, double combos) plus the fact that it is much more challenging, for Joachim is absurdly overpowred in Covenant.
author: Leonardo Diniz

text: Yeh I agree with Joachim being to powerful.  Another gameplay aspect they dropped the ball in covenant was yuri's monster acquisition.  I liked the y way he got monster in the first shadow hearts game way better, and also in addition to Joachim being overpowered yuris lvl 3 fire fusion with energy charge you could kill most bosses in one round if you had a mind's eye equipped, but that's y I never used him.
